title: fix(panel): Ensure panel layout waits for async footprints to resolve
description: Fixes incorrect board sizing and placement in panel layout by ensuring it waits for asynchronous footprints to resolve before rendering.
body:
This change corrects an issue where panel layout would run before asynchronous footprints (e.g., from an external      
library) were fully loaded. This caused incorrect board sizing and placement within the panel.                               

By adding a render phase dependency, panel layout now waits for all footprints to resolve, ensuring accurate board dimensions and correct positioning. A new test case has been added to verify this behavior.

title: Preserve forked package visibility (TSC-285)
description: Ensures a newly forked package inherits the same visibility (privatepublic) as the source package and fixes inconsistent behavior between the package header fork flow and the editor fork flow by passing the is_private flag to the API.
body:
### Motivation
- Ensure a newly forked package inherits the same visibility (`private`/`public`) as the source package.
- Fix inconsistent behavior between the package header fork flow and the editor fork flow so both send visibility to the API.
- Pass the `is_private` flag to the registry `POST /packages/fork` endpoint so forks are created with the intended visibility.

### Description
- Update the header fork hook `useForkPackageMutation` to accept an object `{ packageId, isPrivate }` and include `is_private` in the POST payload to `/packages/fork`.
- Change the UI call in `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/package-header.tsx` to call `forkPackage({ packageId, isPrivate })` instead of passing just the id.
- Add `is_private: pkg?.is_private` to the editor fork implementation in `src/hooks/useForkPackageMutation.ts` so the editor flow also preserves visibility.

### Testing
- No automated tests were run for this change.

------

title: Add buildCommand support to tscircuit config
description: Allow projects to specify a buildCommand in tscircuit.config.json as an override for what to run during cloud builds, without changing local tsci build behavior.
body:
### Motivation
- Allow projects to specify a `buildCommand` in `tscircuit.config.json` as an override for what to run during cloud builds, without changing local `tsci build` behavior.
- Make the new `buildCommand` configurable via the CLI so projects can set it with `tsci config set`.

### Description
- Add `buildCommand` to the project config Zod schema in `lib/project-config/project-config-schema.ts`.
- Add `buildCommand` to the JSON schema in `types/tscircuit.config.schema.json` so schema validation and editor tooling recognize it.
- Expose `buildCommand` in the CLI by adding it to `availableProjectConfigKeys` and supporting it in `cli/config/set/register.ts` with updated argument help text.
- No runtime build behavior changes were made; this change only surfaces the config option and persistence.

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran code formatting with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.

title: feat: Add straight line deviation penalty to improve routing quality
description: Adds a new hyperparameter STRAIGHT_LINE_DEVIATION_FACTOR to the PortPointPathingSolver that penalizes paths deviating from the straight line between connection endpoints, improving routing quality and reducing path complexity.
body: This change adds a new hyperparameter `STRAIGHT_LINE_DEVIATION_FACTOR` to the PortPointPathingSolver that penalizes paths that deviate significantly from the straight line between connection endpoints. This encourages more direct routing and reduces unnecessarily complex paths. Key improvements: - Routes that deviate from the optimal straight line path are penalized in the A* heuristic - Reduces excessive path complexity (e.g., 33+ points reduced to 5 points for vertical connections, in bugreport28) The best penalization factor I found was 4, providing good routing quality improvements while avoiding over-constraining the algorithm. There were also some performance improvements in some tests: before: after: bugreport8 is now solver, before: after:

title: Add auto_jumper autorouter preset
description: Adds support for a new autorouter preset named auto_jumper and keeps a deprecated kebab-case alias for backwards compatibility.
body:
### Motivation
- Add support for a new autorouter preset named `auto_jumper` and keep a deprecated kebab-case alias for backwards compatibility. 
- Ensure the runtime validation and TypeScript types accept the new preset. 
- Keep generated docs and type artifacts in sync with the source definitions as required by repository guidelines.

### Description
- Added `"auto_jumper"` and deprecated `"auto-jumper"` to the `AutorouterPreset` TypeScript union and the `preset` Zod enum in `lib/components/group.ts` and related Zod unions. 
- Added a unit test in `tests/autorouter.test.ts` to validate parsing of the `auto_jumper` preset. 
- Regenerated documentation and type artifacts, updating `generated/COMPONENT_TYPES.md` and `generated/PROPS_OVERVIEW.md` to reflect the new preset. 

### Testing
- Ran `bun test tests/autorouter.test.ts`, which passed all tests (6 pass, 0 fail). 
- Ran `bunx tsc --noEmit` to typecheck the project, which completed successfully. 
- Ran `bun run format` to format the repository, which completed successfully.

replaced the logic with if we have stroke width `hasStroke = true`

title: fix(layout): Correct group PCB layout for asynchronously-loaded children
description: Fixes incorrect group sizing and positioning in PCB layout when children with external footprints are asynchronously loaded, ensuring accurate bounds calculation during render cycles.
body: When a group contained children with external footprints, its bounds were calculated before the children's full dimensions were known, leading to incorrect group sizing and positioning. This was particularly noticeable in panels, where it could cause entire boards to be offset. This fix refactors the group's bounds calculation so it can be re-run on subsequent render cycles, ensuring the layout is correctly updated after asynchronous footprints are loaded. before & after:

title: Add `--ci` flag and extract CI build handling to `cli/build/build-ci.ts`
description: Add a --ci flag to the tsci build command that allows for CI-friendly builds by installing dependencies and executing project-defined build steps before the normal build process.
body:
### Motivation
- Provide a CI-friendly mode for `tsci build` that installs dependencies and runs project-defined build steps before the normal build pipeline.
- Move the CI orchestration code out of the big `register.ts` action into a focused helper to improve readability and testability.
- Support projects that declare `prebuildCommand` and `buildCommand` in `tscircuit.config.json` so CI can run custom build steps or fall back to sensible default CI options.

### Description
- Added a new helper module `cli/build/build-ci.ts` that exports `applyCiBuildOptions`, installs project dependencies, runs optional `prebuildCommand`/`buildCommand` via `execSync`, and returns either handled=true or modified `resolvedOptions` for the remaining build flow.
- Wired the `--ci` CLI option in `cli/build/register.ts` to call `applyCiBuildOptions` and return early when a project `buildCommand` was executed, otherwise continue with the normal build flow using the resolved options.
- Introduced the `BuildCommandOptions` type and switched downstream checks to use `resolvedOptions` so CI can modify runtime options (e.g. enable `previewImages`, `transpile`, `site`, `useCdnJavascript`, and `ignoreErrors` by default).

### Testing
- Ran TypeScript typecheck with `bunx tsc --noEmit`, which succeeded.
- Ran code formatter with `bun run format`, which completed successfully.

------

title: fix: validate circuit JSON files to prevent parsing crashes and improve UX
description: Add robust JSON validation and error handling to prevent crashes from invalid or malformed circuit files, providing users with clear, inline error messages instead of application crashes or silent failures.
body: **Add robust JSON validation and error handling to prevent crashes from invalid or malformed circuit files. Users now get clear, inline error messages instead of application crashes or silent failures.** ### Changes: - Implement isValidCircuitJson validation with type guards and structure checks - Add JSON parsing error handling with specific error messages - Replace alert dialogs with inline error display in upload interface - Prevent navigation away from workspace when validation fails ### Validation includes: - JSON syntax errors (malformed JSON) - Empty/invalid circuit arrays - Missing required fields (type properties) - Unsupported file formats ### Before: https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d3cc7278-0e2c-43af-af94-ed93024825d6 ### After:

title: Add previously failing case, introduce stochastic gradient descent optimizer, make scale-invariant via initial hop distance calculation
description: This pull request introduces a previously failing test case, implements a stochastic gradient descent optimizer, and ensures that the calculations are scale-invariant by incorporating an initial hop distance calculation. The changes aim to enhance the performance and reliability of the hypergraph solver by addressing specific issues that were causing failures in previous implementations.
